page.title: 05HOUSING, FAMILY SIZE
page.content: {(Housing in Marlpool). } The area we have studied is called Marlpool because of the old clay pits on Ilkeston road. The housing in the area has all been built since the clay pits became disused. Most of the houses belonged to the council originally and were built in 1946. Today half of the houses are private and half are council owned. 70% of the houses are semi-detached. Most of them have 5 or more rooms and are heated by gas. There are a very few cottages and flats and some bungalows for the old. {(Family size) } The average family size in this area is 2 adults and 2 children. Of families with children 49% have 2 children 23%-3,16%-1,5%-4,1%-5,11% of families have only one parent living at home. About 30% of households have no children living at home.
